clues.text: Not just Doja Cat but Billie Eilish & Lizzo uploaded early efforts to this platform, SC for short
When Doja Cat began a song this unusual type of person "Like Me", it took some back to an Adina Howard hit of the '90s
In 2023 Ne-Yo won this TV competition show dressed as a cow, just like Doja Cat was in her "Mooo!" video
Doja Cat calling her debut album "Amala", her real first name, is in a tradition with Eminem's 2000 release called this "LP"
Doja Cat's blown-out hair for the retro "Say So" video recalled this TV star, Jill Munroe on "Charlie's Angels" back in the day
For this Seussian pachyderm, the situation's intense! As "your egg is so small, ma'am, and I'm so immense"
"Well, I am pretty... there's no denying that. Almost all spiders are rather nice-looking", says this character
In "How to Catch" one of these, "The night is dark, the streets are quiet, St. Patrick's Day is near"
A nameless talking cricket is not only introduced to this title character in Chapter 4 but also killed by him with a hammer
Peter & Judy find a box containing this, "a jungle adventure game" that truly brings the jungle home to its players
A taxi & a ball of cotton to clean a wound
Breath for a runner & the crust of a cheese
A hack from one's chest & unbaked bread
A tart citrus fruit & an evil spirit
A convoy of cars, perhaps escorting the president, & a sauce made with mayo & capers used on po' boys
A 2022 M.I.T. study examined the physics behind the process of twisting these sandwich cookies apart
This state's first English language newspaper was the Sandwich Island Gazette & Journal of Commerce, which dates back to 1836
1970 film in which Jack Nicholson, in order to get toast, requests a chicken salad sandwich, "Hold the chicken, bring me the toast"
A wearable one of these advertising items includes 2 panels with straps to place it over the shoulders
Incorporated in 1639, Sandwich is the oldest town on this cape in southeastern Massachusetts

rounds.comments: (Ken: One of those words will be in each response.)

clues.text: When chickens do this, it means earlier actions cause trouble later
To blow up in anger, referring to the flight of missiles
Nick Woodman came up with it to film himself & his friends surfing
This hymn says, "Above the earth rang out the angel chorus that hailed our Savior's birth"
To woo with this seductive "look" is to invite further attention & implies get adjacent to me
Last New Year's Eve was a popular wedding date because you can say it this way, as if counting steps for a waltz
Leon  is Noel backwards & Leon Day  is this date at the start of summer
It's Devil's Night in Michigan, Mischief Night in New Jersey & Cabbage Night in New England
John Adams believed this date on which Congress actually declared independence would become a national holiday
Stephen King wrote the novel "11/22/63"; Michael Eric Dyson wrote a nonfiction book about this date that "Changed America"
This type of cupboard gets its name from its former use: storing weapons
Tradition says the first piece of this woven furniture to arrive in America was a baby cradle on the Mayflower in 1620
This piece of furniture is the title of a song by Wet Leg; it's also repeated all day long in the chorus
Footstool options include the ottoman, which offers storage, & this, also a word for a clump of grass, which does not
In 1994 Herman Miller introduced this ergonomic chair, called "the world's most coveted office chair"
"A trusted theatre resource since 1884", it first used its black & yellow logo in the 1950s
In 2021 this magazine changed its name to Scout Life, reflecting a new diversity in its parent organization
This mag has been rocking & rating since 1936, when the public had little reliable info to buy a console radio or straight razor
Look on grandpa's toilet tank for issues of this magazine of the U.S. past founded by Civil War historian Bruce Catton
This periodical named for financier Clarence W. is a sister publication of The Wall Street Journal
At the end of this Christopher Nolan film, a shaken Guy Pearce asks, "Now, where was I"?
Charles Boyer tries to drive Ingrid Bergman crazy in this thriller we're sure you've seen before
Deeming light speed too slow, the villain in this film opts for "ludicrous speed", then things get plaid
This Sidney Lumet drama is set at the Union Broadcasting Systems
The title of this Ethan Hawke sci-fi flick is spelled using the letters representing the 4 DNA bases
It means "before birth" & is the title of a 1993 No. 1 album
A sculpture of King Decebalus is 180' high & carved into a Danube cliff, so you need to see it this way, Latin for "where it is"
This narrative device is in contrast to beginning a story ab ovo ("from the egg")
Penitents can feel relieved when they hear this phrase that comes right after the Latin for "I absolve you from your sins"
It means for oneself, especially when going to court without a lawyer
Keats' "Ode on Melancholy" wants you to wallow in sadness, so "No, no, go not to" this mythic river of forgetfulness
"One calm summer night", the title figure of this Edwin Arlington Robinson poem "went home and put a bullet through his head"
"The Awful Rowing Toward God" by this American was published in 1975, the year after she took her own life
He wrote about how the world keeps spinning while we suffer & grieve in poems like "Musée des Beaux Arts" & "Funeral Blues"
In "Sympathy", this poet wrote, "I know why the caged bird beats his wing till its blood is red on the cruel bars"

rounds.category: WE QUOTE THE REALITY TV SHOW

clues.text: "I open the door, & Khloé slams the door right in my face.  & it infuriates me, like I literally want to kill her... I'm so angry"
"Impersonating Beyoncé is not your destiny, child"
"You are the new head of household"; also, "Rachel is a complete ho-bag.  Seriously, girl?...  Straight-up jealous of me... since day 1"
"I've never given a handshake for a showstopper before...  That is a fantastic cake.  Well done"
clues.response: The Great British Baking Show (or The Great British Bake-Off)

clues.text: "Seaside's so beautiful!  Look at the garbage"

rounds.text: A centuries-old type of performance, this word includes Greek roots meaning "imitator of all"
